newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia May exports 17.25 billion ringgit.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia May exports 17.25 billion ringgit.

text.p: Malaysia, which recorded a trade surplus of 156.8 million ringgit in May, posted 17.25 billion ringgit in exports and 17.10 billion ringgit in imports, the national Bernama news agency reported on Monday.

The trade balance figure was announced on Saturday by Finance Minister and acting Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim. In April, Malaysia posted a trade gap of 2.1 billion ringgit, Bernama said, quoting a Statistics Department report.

From January to May, cumulative exports totalled 81.84 billion ringgit, while imports were 81.79 billion ringgit, Bernama reported. The country posted a surplus of 49.1 million ringgit for the first five months of the year.
